intro: Streblacanthus chirripensis, commonly known as the Costa Rican bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to purple. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as montane forests and is often found at elevations between 1,000 and 2,000 meters. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and have a smooth texture, while its stems are usually woody and somewhat branched. Streblacanthus chirripensis plays a role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators and contributing to the biodiversity of its habitat.
